title: Marhamchurch to Bude Canal Walk Route

images.title: Mark Ward / Pinch Hill, Marhamchurch
images.caption: Pinch Hill, Marhamchurch Looking south east towards pinch hill from the Hele Valley Trail. The river Strat lies below in the valley. The Hele Valley trail is 2 footpaths within an area of newly planted woodland, there's also a Geocache nearby.

images.title: David Kitching / Marhamchurch Foundry
images.caption: Marhamchurch Foundry. Looking down the lane which runs parallel to the course of the Marhamchurch incline plane. The buildings at the bottom were once a foundry.

images.title: Julian P Guffogg / Church at Marhamchurch
images.caption: Church at Marhamchurch. The historic church dates back to the 14th century.

images.title: End of the Marhamchurch arm of the Bude Canal by Maurice D Budden, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: End of the Marhamchurch arm of the Bude Canal

images.caption: Marhamchurch Cottages

images.title: A lock on the Bude Canal by Maurice D Budden, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: A lock on the Bude Canal

images.title: Nilfanion, CC BY-SA 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Bude Canal in Bude, Cornwall, just above the sea locks. There are a number of kayaks on the canal.

images.title: Pierre Terre / Neet Valley
images.caption: Neet Valley from the cycle path. View up the valley towards Helebridge.

description: This pretty village in North Cornwall is located near the coast in the Bude area. This circular walk from the village takes you along the Bude Canal to neighbouring Bude before returning on a shared cycle path. Along the way there's pleasant waterside paths and some lovely views of the River Neet valley countryside. You could extend the walk by heading west to pick up the Bude to Widemouth Bay Walk and enjoy a lovely coastal walk along the South West Coast Path .
